Package it.polimi.se2019.controller

Class EffectController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.controller.Observer
      • it.polimi.se2019.controller.EffectController
  • public class EffectController
extends Observer
    This class contains all the logic related to the execution of an effect. It gets called after a player has chosen it, or by the use of PowerUp.

    • Method Detail

      • getMatch

        public Match getMatch()
        Description copied from class: Observer
        Gets the match that is being computed.
        Specified by:
        getMatch in class Observer
        Returns:

      • nextStep

        void nextStep()
        Read the next ActionType to be executed and call the method to check if the effect needs a Direction. If there is no next ActionType prepare clean the EffectController for a new input.

      • processStep

        private void processStep()
        Check the value of the current ActionType and call the proper method to prepare for user input

      • updateOnPlayers

        public void updateOnPlayers​(java.util.List<Player> originalPlayers)
        players is a list of players provided from the user to which the current Move or DealDamage is applied.
        Overrides:
        updateOnPlayers in class Observer
        Parameters:
        originalPlayers - a List of Player to which the current subeffect is applied

      • updateOnTiles

        public void updateOnTiles​(java.util.List<Tile> tiles)
        If the current sub effect is Move tiles contains a single Tile to which the selected objects must be moved. If the current sub effect is DealDamage tiles contains the targets for the area damage.
        Overrides:
        updateOnTiles in class Observer
        Parameters:
        tiles - a target for Move(must contain a single tile) or DealDamage
        See Also:
        Tile

      • updateOnRoom

        public void updateOnRoom​(Color room)
        Checks if the room is valid and apply the current DealDamage to all the Player in the room (but the player itself). If the room is not a valid target signals the mistake to the player. Only check for using samePlayerRoom and Visibility filters.
        Overrides:
        updateOnRoom in class Observer
        Parameters:
        room - the color of the target room

      • updateOnStopSelection

        public void updateOnStopSelection​(ThreeState skip)
        Handles receiving a stop from the client. No non-reverting stops are accepted into the EffectController, so it always reverts the action.
        Overrides:
        updateOnStopSelection in class Observer
        Parameters:
        skip -

      • processMove

        private void processMove()
        Ask the player for the proper target after checking the current Move Supports:
      • Moving the player perspective, an helping position for defining complex effects
      • Moving the player itself
      • Moving other players, asking the player who to move.

  • processDealDamage

    private void processDealDamage()
    Ask the player for the proper target after checking the current DealDamage Supports:
  • Attacking every player in a Tile
  • Attacking every player in a Room
  • Attack single players
  • If all the tiles need to be selected, attack every tile
    • The target gets parsed from Target, using the related Predicates.

  • filterPlayers

    private void filterPlayers​(java.util.List<Player> playersToFilter,
                           Target target)
    It filters playersToFilter with additional rules for players object of a move action. It supports the move of spawnPoints, authorized only if the move into the same Tile they are.
    Parameters:
    playersToFilter - filtered list
    target - used to filter the players

  • processTargetSource

    private void processTargetSource​(Target target)
    Checks the current target and select the players to be moved if no input is needed. Additional checks if the targets imposes to hit players in Weapon.targetPlayers or Weapon.blackListPlayers. Asks the players to move to the Player if needed.
    Parameters:
    target - the current Move target

  • playerTargets

    private java.util.List<Player> playerTargets​(Target target)
    Checks what players can be selected using the current target. Checks for acceptable Players, using Weapon.blackListPlayers and Weapon.targetPlayers. Checks for acceptable tiles, using Target.getFilterTiles(Board, Tile, Direction)
    Parameters:
    target -
    Returns:

  • tileTargets

    private java.util.List<Tile> tileTargets​(Target target)
    Checks what tiles can be selected, following #target.
    Parameters:
    target -
    Returns:
    list of selectable tiles

  • handleTargeting

    private void handleTargeting​(ThreeState targeting,
                             java.util.List<Player> players)
    Sets the players in the lists after the weapon gets used, if the current SubEffect targets them.
    Parameters:
    targeting - specify how to target them, using the Target
    players - list of moved / hit players to target

  • checkPointOfView

    private boolean checkPointOfView​(Target target)
    Check the pointOfView required by the target for the current sub effect and set it accordingly. Handles the case when Target.pointOfView is PointOfView.LASTPLAYER, and a Domination spawn is hit (t.h.o.r)
    Parameters:
    target -

  • checkPowerUps

    private void checkPowerUps​(java.util.List<Player> players)
    Checks the powerUps after a damage is dealt.
  • Checks if the damaging player has Moment.DAMAGING powerUps, and if so ask whether to use them or not.
  • Checks if the damaged players have Moment.DAMAGED powerUps, and if so ask all of them, asynchronously, to select them.
    • Parameters:
    players -

  • updateDirection

    public boolean updateDirection​(Target target)
    Utility method to update the current Effect.direction. If direction need to be asked, asks to the current player for a direction, and updates the related attribute.
    Returns:
    false if the player didn't answer and flow need to be stopped

  • updateMoveOnPlayers

    private void updateMoveOnPlayers​(java.util.List<Player> players)
    Handles the move of selected players, from client input or directly from the card.
  • If the possible tile is one, it automatically moves the players.
  • If the possible tiles are more than one, it prompt the user with the choice.
  • It resets the action if there are no possible tiles.
    • Parameters:
    players -

  • updateDealDamageOnPlayers

    private void updateDealDamageOnPlayers​(java.util.List<Player> players)
    Handles shooting players chosen by client. Supports:
  • Shooting all players in the targetLists if Target.maxTargets is 0, without checking the user choice.
  • Shooting players from the user choice if conditions are checked
    • Checks powerUps for different applicability.
    Parameters:
    players -

  • updateOnPowerUps

    public void updateOnPowerUps​(java.util.List<PowerUp> powerUps)
    Receive a powerUp that can be used after a inflicting damage and prepare the controller for executing its effect Assumptions:
  • Moment.damaging powerup inflict damage
  • Moment.damaging powerup require a Ammo.ANY ammo.
    Overrides:
    updateOnPowerUps in class Observer
    Parameters:
    powerUps - a single powerUp to be used

  • getOriginalPlayer

    private Player getOriginalPlayer​(Player sandboxPlayer)
    Helper method to get original Players from sandboxPlayers, created to keeping the state of the original match.
    Parameters:
    sandboxPlayer -
    Returns:

  • getSandboxPlayer

    private Player getSandboxPlayer​(Player originalTargetPlayer)
    Helper method to get sandboxPlayer from originalPlayer, created to keeping the state of the original match.
    Parameters:
    originalTargetPlayer -
    Returns:

  • getSandboxPlayers

    private java.util.List<Player> getSandboxPlayers​(java.util.List<Player> originalTargetPlayers)
    Get a list of sandboxPlayers, starting from a list of original Players. It uses getSandboxPlayers(List).
    Parameters:
    originalTargetPlayers -
    Returns:
    a list of players in the curMatch

  • setPlayer

    public void setPlayer​(Player player)
